positions.title: LEO Research Associate (Postdoctoral)
positions.description: LEO lab at Plaksha University invites applications for a Postdoctoral Associate position in the field of labor and personnel economics. The selected candidate will work closely with faculty members and research teams on projects related to labor markets, human capital, productivity, personnel economics, and related topics. The ideal candidate will have strong quantitative skills and experience in data collection, cleaning, and analysis of primary and secondary datasets.
responsibilities: Conduct empirical research on topics related to labor and personnel economics
Collect, clean, and analyse primary and secondary data
Assist in the development and execution of research projects
Perform literature reviews and contribute to research papers
Prepare reports, presentations, and manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals
Collaborate with research teams, including faculty, graduate students, and external partners
Present findings at seminars, workshops, and conferences
requirements: A Ph.D. in Economics or a related field (completed or expected by the start date)
Strong background in labor economics, personnel economics, or related areas
Proficiency in econometric techniques and statistical software (e.g., Stata, R, Python)
Experience working with large datasets and survey data
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a research environment
Prior experience in academic research, including publications, is preferred but not required

positions.title: LEO Lab Co-ordinator
positions.description: LEO lab at Plaksha University invites applications for a Lab Co-ordinator position in the field of labor and personnel economics. The selected candidate will help organize events (workshops, conferences, experiments, faculty visits) and work closely with faculty members and research teams on projects related to labor markets, human capital, productivity, personnel economics, and related topics. The ideal candidate will have strong quantitative skills and experience in analysis of secondary datasets.
responsibilities: Organize events for LEO Lab and help with applying for funding these events
Assist in the development and execution of research projects
Perform literature reviews, prepare policy briefs and contribute to research papers
Prepare reports, presentations, and manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals
Collaborate with research teams, including faculty, graduate students, and external partners
requirements: A Master's in economics or a related field (completed or expected by the start date) from a reputed University
Work experience of 2+ years is preferred in data science / economics domains
A background in labor economics, personnel economics, or related areas is preferred
Proficiency in econometric techniques and statistical software (e.g., Stata, R, Python) is preferred
Some experience working with large datasets and survey data is preferred
Excellent organization, interpersonal, and verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently, troubleshoot, and deal with issues/challenges in administrative operations
Working knowledge of standard office software, including Microsoft Office
Familiarity with digital communications, spreadsheet, and database software
